jobTitle: Bilingual Front Desk Office Manager's Needed - Entertainment
description:
**Previous Office Manager/Office Coordinator experience working with vendors**

**Previous experience in event planning, event marketing, promotions, event production, digital production, fundraising coordinator, venue/resort/hotel/hospitality coordinator, festival coordinator, fashion/sports coordinator is a HUGE PLUS**

  • Hours: 9am to 5:30pm (flexibility to do a 30 minute or 1 hour lunch) some
  • Days: Monday to Friday, must be able to work occasionally weekends, and holidays as needed for events
  • Dress: Business Casual
  • Parking: Provided on site
  • Report To: HR Director


JOB REQUIREMENTS (NO EXCEPTIONS):

  • Must speak, read, and write in Spanish
  • Excellent written skills (email communication) – owner of company is VERY BIG on proper grammar
  • PowerPoint proficiency
  • MAC OS proficiency (company does not use PC/Windows OS)
  • Google Suite proficiency (Google Docs, Google Slides, Google Sheets, Google Drive)
  • Experience using Trello or Slack is a plus but NOT required


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Reception and Guest Management:

  • Receive and welcome company guests
  • Answer the company's main phone line, transfer calls, and take/deliver messages to staff
  • Ensure everyone is parked in their appropriate spots


Office Maintenance and Upkeep:

  • Maintain office printers
  • Maintain and clean communal areas, including reception area, conference rooms (2), kitchen areas (5), library (1), and hallways
  • Manage office cleaning vendor
  • Sort and distribute daily mail delivery
  • Order, restock, organize and maintain inventory of all office and kitchen supplies
  • Ability to lift up to 50lbs
  • Assist with planning and coordinating office projects, such as office moves, events, or technology upgrades.


Administrative Support:

  • Provide job applications as needed
  • Manage and update the company calendar and event grid using
  • Use Trello app to track projects
  • Coordinate with IT and Human Resources for new hire setup
  • Maintain and distribute company collateral
  • Handle permits in coordination with managements
  • Leaded the end-to-end bid process, including opportunity identification, qualification, and proposal submission
  • Accept work samples/bids proposals for potential new businesses opportunities by monitoring public and private boxes/bins portals
  • Continuously refine and improve processes, templates, and best practices to enhance efficiency and effectiveness of office


Inventory and Vendor Management:

  • Manage office accounts with FedEx, Amazon, and Staples etc.
  • Manage inventory and distribution of left-over event items
  • Manage staff recognition process: Birthdays and holiday gifts
  • Manage company employee gift (SWAG) program, including inventory, employee sizes, and distribution


Apply for this great position as a Bilingual Spanish Front Desk Office Manager today! Please forward resume for immediate consideration and/or call the office and ask for Azuri Ross in the AppleOne Bunker Hill Downtown Los Angeles office.
